abstract.p: Hugo Boss, fashion designer, is opening flagship store in Manhattan at 715 Fifth Avenue (S)

block.p: Hugo Boss, the fashion designer, is finally opening a flagship store in Manhattan, among some of the most expensive shopping real estate in the country.

Hugo Boss, the fashion designer, is finally opening a flagship store in Manhattan, among some of the most expensive shopping real estate in the country.

Boss signed a lease last week for a 23,000-square-foot store at 717 Fifth Avenue, at the southeast corner of 56th Street. The four-story store, which will have a 40-foot ceiling and an atrium, is in a neighborhood that includes Harry Winston jewelers, Bulgari, Tiffany and Prada, plus two of the most lucrative stores in the Gap and Banana Republic chains.
Jedd Nero, executive vice president of Newmark New Spectrum Retail, the broker for Boss, said the store will have a small cafe and carry men's clothing as well as a new line of women's fashions.
''This will be one of the largest designer stores in the country,'' he said. ''And it'll be twice as big as any of the 300 existing Boss stores.''
Storefront rents in the area, which attracts tourists and well-heeled shoppers, have soared to more than $600 a square foot, or double what retailers are paying in Times Square.

''Fashion retailers are still committed to being on Fifth Avenue no matter what the price,'' said Robert K. Futterman, a retail broker who was not involved in the deal. ''It's still a place where people want to make a statement.''
